alert.note: Alert for Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 16 at 5:45AM CDT until August 17 at 3:07PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Rio Grande At Foster Ranch affecting Val Verde County. For the Rio Grande...including Foster Ranch...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rio Grande At Foster Ranch. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, (6.7 meters), major lowland flooding occurs above Dryden to Amistad Reservoir. Below Foster Ranch, the river is one third mile wide and covers the right flood plain to the canyon wall. Campers, autos, gear and livestock flood anywhere in the Rio Grande canyon bottom and will wash downstream. Canoeing and kayaking are extremely dangerous in the Rio Grande River above Dryden to Amistad Reservoir. Turbulent flow, huge eddies and whirlpools occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 22.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.7 feet on 07/18/1976. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Rio Grande Foster Ranc 14.0 9.7 Tue 5 am CDT 6.9 1.9 1.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM CDT.
